clients.name: Apple
clients.title: Senior Quality Engineering Architect
points: Architected and implemented MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for secure orchestration of AI agents across STLC phases, enabling intelligent test automation
Designed AI/ML-based quality engineering solutions using RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) and LLMs for predictive test case generation and self-healing automation
Led full-stack test automation framework development for Web, Mobile, API, and Database testing using Python, Selenium, and Appium
Implemented Multi-Agent Orchestration Systems leveraging Agentic AI for autonomous test execution and intelligent defect prediction
Drove Test Data Management (TDM) strategies ensuring robust and scalable test environments for enterprise applications
Provided solution architecture and technical consulting for quality transformation initiatives, delivering 40% reduction in regression cycles

clients.name: Intuit
clients.title: Senior Software Engineer
points: Developed and maintained scalable microservices for financial services platform using Java and Spring Boot, processing millions of daily transactions
Architected AI-driven workflows for automated code review and test case generation using LLMs and RAG pipelines
Built robust API integrations and RESTful services with comprehensive security and performance validation
Implemented cloud-native solutions using Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins and GitHub Actions
Collaborated with cross-functional teams on solution design and technical assessments for enterprise clients
Designed distributed systems architecture supporting real-time payment processing and fraud detection modules

PayPal_QE.title: Senior SDET / QE Lead
points: Led quality engineering initiatives for PayPal's '4th Party Payout' compliance system, ensuring regulatory adherence for payment processing
Architected and implemented comprehensive API test automation frameworks using REST Assured and Java 8/11
Designed risk-based testing strategies for fraud detection and payment processing modules, achieving 99%+ defect-free releases
Implemented CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Docker for automated regression testing integrated with the CI pipeline
Built end-to-end test automation for compliance scanning logic, improving test coverage by 60%
Utilized Apache Spark and Kibana for test data analysis, metrics monitoring, and defect trend analysis
Collaborated with cross-functional teams on compliance testing for financial regulations and security standards

PayPal_SWE.title: Senior Software Engineer
points: Led Java development projects focusing on compliance scanning logic for the '4th Party Payout' system
Developed backend scanning logic using Java 8/11, significantly improving compliance accuracy for financial transactions
Built RESTful APIs and microservices for payment processing and payout validation workflows
Implemented containerized deployments using Docker and orchestrated CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins
Designed and developed backend services handling millions of daily payment transactions
Utilized Apache Spark for large-scale data processing and Kibana for application monitoring and analytics
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver high-performance backend solutions for compliance systems

Altimetrik.note: Parent company - worked with multiple enterprise clients

points: Key member of the Quality Engineering Center of Excellence (CoE), driving best practices and accelerators
Designed and developed multiple automation framework POCs for enterprise clients including Visa and Intuit
Created reusable automation accelerators and IP assets that reduced project delivery timelines by 30%
Led knowledge sharing initiatives and mentored engineering teams on automation best practices
Contributed to pre-sales activities and RFP responses for QE transformation engagements

instructions: IMPORTANT: Include PayPal experience (Mar 2020 - Aug 2021) between Ancestry and Proofpoint. Show Altimetrik as parent company for Intuit, Ancestry, PayPal. Emphasize CoE and POC work.
